meanings.definition: A person who shares a coin with another.
meanings.sent1: My friend is my coinmate because we always split the coins we find.
meanings.sent2: I found a coinmate at the arcade who wanted to share tokens for the games.
meanings.sent3: When I lost my coin, my coinmate kindly offered to share theirs with me.
meanings.sent4: In the world of numismatics, a coinmate is like a treasure-hunting buddy.
meanings.sent5: Having a reliable coinmate makes collecting coins more enjoyable.

meanings.definition: To pair or match coins with another person.
meanings.sent1: Let's coinmate our pennies and see who has the oldest one.
meanings.sent2: We can coinmate our quarters to see if we have any rare ones.
meanings.sent3: I coinmate with my sibling to see who can find the most unique coins.
meanings.sent4: Coinmating our collections feels like a fun game of treasure hunting.
meanings.sent5: The friends decided to coinmate their coins to compare their finds.

meanings.definition: To be a companion or partner in coin-related activities.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy coinmating with my brother when we go coin collecting.
meanings.sent2: She loves to coinmate with her friends at the coin show every year.
meanings.sent3: Coinmating with my dad always leads to interesting discoveries.
meanings.sent4: Coinmating with a fellow enthusiast can make coin collecting more exciting.
meanings.sent5: Being a coinmate means always having someone to share your hobby with.
